alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:56PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache County through 530 PM MST... At 455 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Hunt, or 30 miles northeast of Show Low, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hunt, Concho, Vernon and Little Ortega Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 354 and 376. Highway 180 between mile markers 332 and 355. State Route 61 between mile markers 354 and 380. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; White Mountains
